Dear Ms. Shenberger:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer,
Section contractors on central registry.
Description (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and suitable
and able to meet the needs of children and families served by the
agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation.
Type
Allegation While Youth A was in the independent living program a staff
member had intercourse with the youth at the staff member's
home multiple times for approximately one month. The staff
member would transport youths to school and monitor youths in
the classroom.
Investigation Interviews:
On 8/29/2025 Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS)
Worker and I interviewed Youth A onsite at Vista Maria. Youth A
denied the allegations and denied reporting such allegations to
anyone. She reported to have had different people transporting
her to school and to only having a mentor like relationship with
male staff. She reported there was a rumor put out by others, that
she and Staff 3 were in a relationship. She did not say who put
out the rumor, but reported the rumor was she and Staff 3 were
doing sexual stuff. She reported the rumors were not true. She
reported Staff 3 worked at the Campus school that she used to
attend; and he was one of the people she would talk to. She
reported talking with him almost every day and doing so kept her
from going off on the other youths. She reported her relationship
with Staff 3 was a mentor relationship. She said he told her it was
a mentor relationship in case she was thinking it was something
more personal. She told him she was not thinking it was personal.
She said she only talked to Staff 3 at school. She denied going to
2

his home or any staff’s home. She also denied a sexual
relationship with him or any staff.
On 8/29/2025 DHHS Worker and I interviewed Complainant in
person. Complainant reported that about a month ago, but
sometime in August 2025, she was not sure of the exact day,
Youth A approached her to say they had a lot to catch up on.
Youth A told her Youth A and a former Vista Maria staff person,
who had worked transporting youths, had been engaging in a
sexual relationship. Complainant reported Complainant asked
Youth A that staff person’s name, but Youth A did not tell her.
Youth A reported prior to the former Vista Maria staff person
quitting his job, Youth A and the former Vista Maria staff person
exchanged telephone information while Youth A was still a
resident in Vista Maria’s Child Caring Institution (CCI) Program.
Complainant said Youth A reported she and The former Vista
Maria staff person did not have contact with each other until Youth
A was in Vista Maria’s Independent Living (IL) Program. The
former Vista Maria staff person picked her up and they went to his
house. They played video games, which led to sex. Youth A
reported the sex happened a few times. Complainant reported
Youth A reported at some point, a specific time was not indicated,
the former Vista Maria staff person reported he did not want to
continue the relationship, because it may lead to them getting
caught. Youth A reported asking the former Vista Maria staff
person why he was breaking up now, as opposed to prior to them
having sex multiple times.
Complainant reported Youth A reported a staff who mentored her,
Staff 1 knew about her relationship with the former Vista Maria
staff person, and Staff 1 told her since the former Vista Maria staff
person was no longer employed, “there was nothing more we can
do”. Youth A showed Complainant a picture of Former Vista
Maria staff person on Youth A’s phone and asked whether
Complainant knew him. Complainant did not. Complainant
reported Staff 1 might be a contingency staff at Vista Maria.
Complainant reported Youth A was of the age of consent and
Former Vista Maria staff person was no longer employed.
Complainant did not know until Consumer’s Rights Officer
indicated during training last week that this matter was to be
reported.
On 8/29/2025 DHHS Worker and I spoke with Consumer’s
Rights Officer. He reported the PREA (Prison Rape Elimination
Act) training was the training Complainant had referenced; and
that training was held on 8/27/2025.
3

He reported Staff 3 was a prior staff at DeRoy. The children were
transported from that residential to the on-ground school Clarie B
Ford, where Youth A had attended. He provided a telephone
number for Staff 1, Staff 3 and Youth A’s worker, Case Manager.
On 9/17/2025 I interviewed Staff 1 by telephone about the
complaint. Staff 1 reported employment with Vista Maria as a full-
time staff from October 2024 until February 2025; and as a
contingency staff until June 2025. Staff 1 confirmed speaking with
DHHS Worker and reporting that she was a mentor to Youth A.
Additionally, that the two of them were close; but Youth A never
disclosed any inappropriate interaction by a male staff. Staff 1
reported the girls in the IL program would spread rumors about
each other and there was a rumor Youth A was talking to Staff 3
at school, but Staff 1 denied ever witnessing those interactions.
Staff 1 reported only knowing Staff 3 by name; and that she only
heard rumors of a relationship between Youth A and Staff 3 via
other staff. She could not recall what staff, nor any details about
the rumors, other than Youth A and Staff 3 talking. She denied
witnessing any interaction between Youth A and Staff 3, stating
she never worked at the school. She reported if a male staff or
anyone was mistreating Youth A, Youth A would her told her. She
reported being aware of Youth A talking to and having
relationships with males. These males were Youth A’s age and
Youth A showed her pictures and texts messages with those
males. Staff 1 said she saw nothing inappropriate in the texts
message she saw.
On 9/30/2025 I interviewed Case Manager by telephone. Case
Manager reported being Youth A’s worker since Youth A entered
IL via Shepard Hall on 2/28/2025. She reported no awareness of
the allegations until the matter was reported on 8/27/2025. She
reported Youth A never disclosed such information to her and
never talked with her about a male relationship other than
mentioning a boyfriend who lived in Lansing, Michigan. Case
Manager denied hearing any rumors of Youth A talking to or being
in a relationship with a male staff. She reported an awareness of
Staff 3 in that he worked via the residential program. He would
have been at Claire B Ford Academy where Youth A attended
school from August 2024 until June 2025, but she never
witnessed any interaction between Staff 3 and Youth A. She
stated she did not work at the residential facility. She reported
she had not spoken with Youth A about the allegations due to the
pending investigation.
4

On 10/1/2025 I interviewed New Direction Case Manager
(NDCM), Youth B’s worker, after I attempted contact with Youth B,
who was a prior IL youth at Vista Maria with Youth A. NDCM
reported Youth B had just been released from the hospital due to
mental health related concerns with auditory and visual
hallucinations, and it would not be advisable to speak with her.
She reported Youth B has only talked about a male person being
in the wall in her room while she was at Vista Maria. Youth B has
never mentioned anything about another youth having or being in
a relationship with a male staff.
On 10/1/2025 I interviewed Youth C by telephone. Youth C
reported knowing Youth A and being in placement with Youth A at
Vista Maria around Thanksgiving of 2024. Youth C said she was
in the Vista Maria IL program for about six months. Youth C
denied an awareness of any male staff being in a sexual
relationship with Youth A. She reported all she knew was that
Youth A was flirting with “some guy, some male” whose name is
spelled and sounds similarly to her’s. She stated she saw Youth
A flirting at him, and he was smiling back at her and that is all that
she knew. She would not confirm where the flirting took place.
It is also noteworthy to report that I attempted to contact Staff 3
without success; and I also tried to contact Youth D and Youth E
via their providers without a call back from anyone.
Document Review:
Youth A’s MISACWIS case record which showed:
• Youth A is a temporary court ward who has been in care
since July 2024.
• She was placed in Vista Maria’s CCI program from
8/13/2024 until 2/27/2025.
• She was placed in Vista Maria IL program on 2/27/2025.
Documentation from Consumer’s Rights Officer showing:
• Staff 1’s date of hire as 10/16/2023 and her termination as
6/3/2025, with her departing due to being out of compliance
with required training.
• Staff 3’s date of hire as 8/5/2024 and that he resigned
7/11/2025 due to him returning to school.
• Staff 1 had two disciplinary actions. Both related to
attendance, a written disciplinary action in July 2024 and a
verbal and written one in February 2024.
• Staff 3 had three disciplinary actions. All related to
attendance, a written discipline action in October 2024 and
a verbal and final one both in February 2025.
5

Vista Maria’s Staff and Client Interaction Policy that indicated:
• All Vista Maria staff should conduct themselves in a
professional and appropriate manner when interacting with
the clients in our care.
• Never give out personal telephone numbers, address, or
social media profile information to clients.
• Do not socialize with current or former clients except
during Vista Maria-sponsored activities.
• Staff members should never present themselves in a
manner that could be construed as flirtatious or sexual in
nature to clients.
Analysis Based on interviews and documents reviewed there is insufficient
evidence to support the allegations or a lack of supervision.
Youth A denied the allegations, and no one else could corroborate
the allegations.
Conclusion Violation Not Established.
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12214 Child protection law
Section The agency shall comply with the child protection law, 1975 PA
Description 238, MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional Findings of Noncompliance
Type
Allegation An agency staff person became aware of alleged maltreatment of
Youth A, a 17-year-old independent living youth, by a prior male
staff and the allegation was not timely reported.
Investigation Interviews:
On 8/29/2025 DHHS Worker and I interviewed Complainant in
person. Complainant reported that about a month ago, but
sometime in August 2025 she was not sure of the exact day,
Youth A approached her to say they had a lot to catch up on.
Youth A told her Youth A and a former Vista Maria staff person,
who had worked transporting youths, had been engaging in a
sexual relationship. Complainant reported Youth A was of the age
of consent and former Vista Maria staff person was no longer
employed. Complainant reported they did not know until last week,
by way of Consumer’s Rights Officer and training that this
matter was to be reported.
On 8/29/2025 DHHS Worker and I spoke with Consumer’s
Rights Officer. He reported the PREA (Prison Rape Elimination
Act) training was the training Complainant had referenced; and
that training was held on 8/27/2025.
Analysis Based on interviews the evidence showed the agency did not
report the allegation immediately or within 24 hours of learning of
the allegation.
6

Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
